alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 5:07PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Banner and southeastern Goshen Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 407 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hawk Springs Campground, or 23 miles south of Torrington, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lyman, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Huntley and Hawk Springs Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
